intro: Ouratea lutea, commonly known as the yellow ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in moist, shaded forests. Ouratea lutea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
